        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Open browser.<span class="line"><!---->2. Click crash.html, and will show popup blocker message.Select "always allow popup from <!----></span>http://localhost:8000<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000"><!---->http://localhost:8000<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span><br><br>4. Close the Browser.<span class="line"><!---->4. Close the Browser.<!----></span><br><br>5. Directly access <span class="line"><!---->5. Directly access <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/crash.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/crash.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/crash.html<!----></a><br>./chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xx <span class="line"><!---->./chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xx <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/crash.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/crash.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/crash.html<!----></a><br>6.           Comment 15<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1175436#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      asamidoi@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->asamidoi@chromium.org<!----></span>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1175436#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 10, 2021, 5:24 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1175436#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 10, 2021, 5:24 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The issue happens due to the destruction timing between RenderFrameHostImpl and DedicatedWorkerHost. The unique pointer of CrossOriginEmbedderPolicyReporter is stored at RenderFrameHostImpl and it's passed and stored in DedicatedWorkerHost as a raw pointer. When RenderFrameHostImpl is destructed, DedicatedWorkerHost and the raw pointer of CrossOriginEmbedderPolicyReporter in DedicatedWorkerHost should be destructed too, but the destruction of DedicatedWorkerHost is triggered by mojo connection. That leads slightly mismatching destruction timing.<span class="line"><!---->The issue happens due to the destruction timing between RenderFrameHostImpl and DedicatedWorkerHost. The unique pointer of CrossOriginEmbedderPolicyReporter is stored at RenderFrameHostImpl and it's passed and stored in DedicatedWorkerHost as a raw pointer. When RenderFrameHostImpl is destructed, DedicatedWorkerHost and the raw pointer of CrossOriginEmbedderPolicyReporter in DedicatedWorkerHost should be destructed too, but the destruction of DedicatedWorkerHost is triggered by mojo connection. That leads slightly mismatching destruction timing.<!----></span><br><br>I'm working on this and will fix soon.<span class="line"><!---->I'm working on this and will fix soon.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/3a2af67fabe29fb5ce09b9b47c0450bd62cb2d3e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/3a2af67fabe29fb5ce09b9b47c0450bd62cb2d3e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/3a2af67fabe29fb5ce09b9b47c0450bd62cb2d3e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>3a2af67fabe29fb5ce09b9b47c0450bd62cb2d3e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/3a2af67fabe29fb5ce09b9b47c0450bd62cb2d3e"><!---->3a2af67fabe29fb5ce09b9b47c0450bd62cb2d3e<!----></a><br>Author: Asami Doi <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Asami Doi &lt;<!----></span>asamidoi@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asamidoi@chromium.org"><!---->asamidoi@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Feb 19 19:23:39 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Feb 19 19:23:39 2021<!----></span><br><br>Make dedicated worker's COEP reporter<span class="line"><!---->Make dedicated worker's COEP reporter<!----></span><br><br>This CL adds worker's COEP reporter and update the raw pointer of<span class="line"><!---->This CL adds worker's COEP reporter and update the raw pointer of<!----></span><br>ancestor's COEP reporter to a weak pointer.<span class="line"><!---->ancestor's COEP reporter to a weak pointer.<!----></span><br><br>Without PlzDedicatedWorker, no behavior changes. Reports are sent to<span class="line"><!---->Without PlzDedicatedWorker, no behavior changes. Reports are sent to<!----></span><br>the ancestor's COEP reporter (same as the current behavior) but it's<span class="line"><!---->the ancestor's COEP reporter (same as the current behavior) but it's<!----></span><br>not align with the spec. When the ancestor's COEP reporter is used, the<span class="line"><!---->not align with the spec. When the ancestor's COEP reporter is used, the<!----></span><br>existence of it is checked to make sure the frame is not destructed.<span class="line"><!---->existence of it is checked to make sure the frame is not destructed.<!----></span><br><br>With PlzDedicatedWorker, reports are sent to the creator's COEP reporter<span class="line"><!---->With PlzDedicatedWorker, reports are sent to the creator's COEP reporter<!----></span><br>if a worker's script loading fails and sent to the worker's COEP<span class="line"><!---->if a worker's script loading fails and sent to the worker's COEP<!----></span><br>reporter if fetch inside a worker fails.<span class="line"><!---->reporter if fetch inside a worker fails.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1175436<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1175436" title="uaf in CrossOriginEmbedderPolicyReporter(browser)"><!---->Bug: 1175436<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>1060837<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1060837" title="Support COEP's report only mode for PlzDedicatedWorker"><!---->1060837<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I2ea6b2d51d381a283b5cc722e4517cfc842967c1<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id:           <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is fixed because the original problematic CL was also reverted.<span class="line"><!---->This is fixed because the original problematic CL was also reverted.<!----></span><br><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2650015<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2650015"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2650015<!----></a><br>This CL caused the UAF issue but it was reverted here: <span class="line"><!---->This CL caused the UAF issue but it was reverted here: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2717382<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2717382"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2717382<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.           Comment 15<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1175436#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      asamidoi@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2476134861" title="asamidoi@chromium.org"><!---->asamidoi@chromium.org<!----></a>
      asamidoi@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->asamidoi@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1175436#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 10, 2021, 5:24 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1175436#c15">Comment 15<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Feb 10, 2021, 5:24 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The issue happens due to the destruction timing between RenderFrameHostImpl and DedicatedWorkerHost. The unique pointer of CrossOriginEmbedderPolicyReporter is stored at RenderFrameHostImpl and it's passed and stored in DedicatedWorkerHost as a raw pointer. When RenderFrameHostImpl is destructed, DedicatedWorkerHost and the raw pointer of CrossOriginEmbedderPolicyReporter in DedicatedWorkerHost should be destructed too, but the destruction of DedicatedWorkerHost is triggered by mojo connection. That leads slightly mismatching destruction timing.<span class="line"><!---->The issue happens due to the destruction timing between RenderFrameHostImpl and DedicatedWorkerHost. The unique pointer of CrossOriginEmbedderPolicyReporter is stored at RenderFrameHostImpl and it's passed and stored in DedicatedWorkerHost as a raw pointer. When RenderFrameHostImpl is destructed, DedicatedWorkerHost and the raw pointer of CrossOriginEmbedderPolicyReporter in DedicatedWorkerHost should be destructed too, but the destruction of DedicatedWorkerHost is triggered by mojo connection. That leads slightly mismatching destruction timing.<!----></span><br><br>I'm working on this and will fix soon.<span class="line"><!---->I'm working on this and will fix soon.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

Reports are sent to<span class="line"><!---->Without PlzDedicatedWorker, no behavior changes. Reports are sent to<!----></span><br>the ancestor's COEP reporter (same as the current behavior) but it's<span class="line"><!---->the ancestor's COEP reporter (same as the current behavior) but it's<!----></span><br>not align with the spec. When the ancestor's COEP reporter is used, the<span class="line"><!---->not align with the spec. When the ancestor's COEP reporter is used, the<!----></span><br>existence of it is checked to make sure the frame is not destructed.<span class="line"><!---->existence of it is checked to make sure the frame is not destructed.<!----></span><br><br>With PlzDedicatedWorker, reports are sent to the creator's COEP reporter<span class="line"><!---->With PlzDedicatedWorker, reports are sent to the creator's COEP reporter<!----></span><br>if a worker's script loading fails and sent to the worker's COEP<span class="line"><!---->if a worker's script loading fails and sent to the worker's COEP<!----></span><br>reporter if fetch inside a worker fails.<span class="line"><!---->reporter if fetch inside a worker fails.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1175436<a class="strike-through"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }

          padding: 0;

        for LitElement.

window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 window.addEventListener('load', () => {

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
